member.name: T:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass
member.summary: Describes what kind of object is being tracked at a given ID

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.Invalid
member.summary: There is no device at this index

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.HMD
member.summary: The device at this index is an HMD

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.Controller
member.summary: The device is a controller

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.GenericTracker
member.summary: The device is a tracker

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.TrackingReference
member.summary: The device is a camera, Lighthouse base station, or other device that supplies tracking ground truth.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DeviceClass.DisplayRedirect
member.summary: Accessories that aren't necessarily tracked themselves, but may redirect video output from other tracked devices

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DummyDevice.UseGyroscope
member.summary: Use the gyroscope of the device to simulate device orientation changes.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.DummyDevice.BuildMirror
member.summary: If true, build the mirror view.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.IsVisible
member.summary: True if the process has VR focus and thus is visible in the HMD.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.HmdPresent
member.summary: True if an HMD is present.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.HmdMounted
member.summary: True if the HMD is on the user's head.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.DisplayLost
member.summary: True if the session is in a display-lost state. See ovr_SubmitFrame.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.ShouldQuit
member.summary: True if the application should initiate shutdown.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.OculusOvr.SessionStatus.ShouldRecenter
member.summary: True if UX has requested re-centering.

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.OpenXRHmd.New(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a VR device using OpenXR.
member.param: Whether or not the XR_FB_passthrough extension should be enabled (if available).

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.OpenXRUtils.CheckResult(Silk.NET.OpenXR.Result,System.String)
member.summary: A simple function which throws an exception if the given OpenXR result indicates an error has been raised.
member.returns: The same result passed in, just in case it's meaningful and we just want to use this to filter out errors.
member.exception: An exception for the given result if it indicates an error.

member.name: P:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.HapticsSupport
member.summary: Degree to which this touch controller type supports haptics. None: no haptics support, controller does not vibrate. Limited: cannot vibrate at any specific frequency or amplitude. Corresponding parameter is ignored. Full: vibrate method respects both frequency and vibration parameters

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsPressedDown(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if in this frame the button switched to pressed state

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsPressed(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if button switched is in the pressed state

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsPressReleased(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if in this frame the button was released

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsTouchedDown(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if in this frame the button switched to pressed state

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsTouched(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if button switched is in the pressed state

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.IsTouchReleased(Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton)
member.summary: Returns true if in this frame the button was released

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchController.Vibrate(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Vibrate the controller for a fixed duration. Do so at specified frequency/amplitude if supported by runtime. Oculus runtime supports vibrating at frequency 0.0, 0.5, or 1.0, and amplitude in range [0.0, 1.0] openVR supports vibrating, but does not support frequency or amplitude openXR and WindowsMixedReality currently do not support vibration.

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Thumbstick
member.summary: Oculus: Thumbstick Vive: Thumb trackpad Windows Mixed Reality: Thumbstick

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Touchpad
member.summary: Oculus: Thumbstick Vive: Thumb trackpad Windows Mixed Reality: Touchpad

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.A
member.summary: Oculus: A Windows Mixed Reality: Right half of right touchpad

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.B
member.summary: Oculus: B Windows Mixed Reality: Left half of right touchpad

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.X
member.summary: Oculus: X Windows Mixed Reality: Left half of left touchpad

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Y
member.summary: Oculus: Y Windows Mixed Reality: Right half of left touchpad

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Trigger
member.summary: Oculus: Trigger Vive : Trigger Windows Mixed Reality: Trigger

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Grip
member.summary: Oculus: Grip Vive: Grip Windows Mixed Reality: Grip

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TouchControllerButton.Menu
member.summary: Oculus: Left controller menu button Vive: Both controllers menu button Windows Mixed Reality: Both controllers menu button

member.name: T:Stride.VirtualReality.TrackingSpace
member.summary: Identifies which style of tracking origin the application wants to use for the poses it is requesting

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TrackingSpace.Seated
member.summary: Poses are provided relative to the seated zero pose

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TrackingSpace.Standing
member.summary: Poses are provided relative to the safe bounds configured by the user

member.name: F:Stride.VirtualReality.TrackingSpace.RawAndUncalibrated
member.summary: Poses are provided in the coordinate system defined by the driver. It has Y up and is unified for devices of the same driver. You usually don't want this one.

member.name: P:Stride.VirtualReality.VRDevice.ViewScaling
member.summary: Allows you to scale the view, effectively it will change the size of the player in respect to the world, turning it into a giant or a tiny ant.
member.remarks: This will reduce the near clip plane of the cameras, it might induce depth issues.

member.name: P:Stride.VirtualReality.VRDevice.SupportsPassthrough
member.summary: Whether or not passthrough is supported by the device. It needs to be requested on device creation by enabling . If supported, passthrough can be started (and stopped) with the method.

member.name: M:Stride.VirtualReality.VRDevice.StartPassthrough
member.summary: Starts a passthrough. When enabled the scene is rendered on top of the camera image of the device.
member.returns: A disposable which will stop the passthrough on dispose.
member.exception: Thrown if the passthrough mode is not supported by the device.
Thrown if the passthrough mode is already enabled.

member.name: T:Stride.StrideVersion
member.summary: Internal version used to identify Stride version.
member.remarks: During package build, PackageUpdateVersionTask is updating that file and expect some specific text regex so be careful if you change any of this.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.PublicVersion
member.summary: The version used by editor for display purpose. The 4th digit will automatically be replaced by the git height when building packages with Stride.Build.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: The current assembly version as text, currently same as .

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSimple
member.summary: The NuGet package version without special tags.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersion
member.summary: The NuGet package version.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSuffix
member.summary: The NuGet package suffix (i.e. -beta).

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.BuildMetadata
member.summary: The build metadata, usually +g[git_hash] during package. Automatically set by Stride.GitVersioning.GenerateVersionFile.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyInformationalVersion
member.summary: The informational assembly version, containing -beta01 or +g[git_hash] during package.

member.name: T:Stride.PublicKeys
member.summary: Assembly signing information.

member.name: F:Stride.PublicKeys.Default
member.summary: Assembly name suffix that contains signing information.

members.member: Finds the active installation of vrclient.dll and initializes it
unloads vrclient.dll. Any interface pointers from the interface are invalid after this point
